00149     protected static $standardElements = array(

00170     /**
00171      * @brief Default constructor.
00172      * @param string $element[optional] The HTML element to create.
00173      * @return void.
00174      */
00175     public function __construct($element = 'div') {
00176         $this->setElement($element);
00177         
00178         if (BOO_CLEARFIX && $this->isClearfixElement($element)) {
00179             $this->addClass('clearfix');
00180         }
00181         
00182         if ($this->isStandardElement($element)) {
00183             // common classes
00184             $this->addClass('php');
00185             $this->addClass('boo');
00186             
00187             self::$count++;
00188         }
00189     }
00190     
00191     /**
00192      * @brief Sets the tag name.
00193      * @param string $element The tag name. Set to FALSE for tagless.
00194      * @param bool $force Force non standard element to be used. Usefull for writing non standard HTML (not that you should do that).
00195      * @return bool Returns TRUE on success, FALSE otherwise.
00196      * 
00197      * @code
00198      * $html->setElement('div');
00199      * @endcode
00200      */
00201     public function setElement($element, $force = false) {
00202         $element = trim(strtolower($element));
00203         
00204         if (self::isSupportedElement($element) || $force || ($element == false)) {
00205             $this->element = $element;
00206             return true;
00207         } else {
00208             trigger_error("Element {$element} is not supported", E_USER_WARNING);
00209             return false;
00210         }
00211     }
00212     
00213     /** 
00214      * @brief Returns the element name.
00215      * @return string The element name.
00216      */
00217     public function getElement() { return $this->element; }

00219     /**
00220      * @brief Determins if an element is valid.

00222      * @param string $element The element to test.
00223      */
00224     public static function isSupportedElement($element) {
00225         $element = trim(strtolower($element));
00226         return in_array($element, self::$supportedElements);
00227     }

00230      * @brief Gets an array of all supported elements.

00233     public static function getSupportedElements() { return self::$supportedElements; }

00272     /**
00273      * @brief Sets the attributes.
00274      * @param array $attrs The attributes .
00275      * @return int Returns the number of attributes set, FALSE on failure.
00276      */
00277     public function setAttrs(array $attrs) {
00278         // do not use array_merge it will allow unsafe values in
00279         $count = 0;
00280         if (!empty($attrs)) {
00281             $this->attributes = array(); // clear array
00282             foreach ($attrs as $key => $value) {
00283                 if ($this->setAttr($key, $value)) {
00284                     $count++;
00285                 }
00286             }
00287         } else {
00288             if (BOO_DEBUG) { trigger_error('Attrs should not be empty', E_USER_NOTICE); }
00289             return false;
00290         }
00291         return $count;
00292     }
00293     
00294     /**
00295      * @brief Adds attributes.
00296      * @param array $attrs The attributes to add.
00297      * @return int Returns the number of attributes added, FALSE on failure.
00298      */
00299     public function addAttrs(array $attrs) {
00300         // do not use array_merge it will allow unsafe values in
00301         $count = 0;
00302         if (!empty($attrs)) {
00303             foreach ($attrs as $key => $value) {
00304                 if ($this->setAttr($key, $value)) {
00305                     $count++;
00306                 }
00307             }
00308         } else {
00309             if (BOO_DEBUG) { trigger_error('Attributes should not be empty', E_USER_NOTICE); }
00310             return false;
00311         }
00312         return $count;
00313     }
00314     
00315     /**
00316      * @brief Returns an array of attributes.
00317      * @param string $attr The attributes name.
00318      * @return array Returns the attributes.
00319      */
00320     public function getAttrs() {return $this->attributes; }
00321     
00322     /**
00323      * @brief Convenience funciton for applying attributes.
00324      * 
00325      * Will only apply attributes if array is not empty.
00326      * 
00327      * @return int Returns the number of attributes applied, FALSE on failure.
00328      * @param array $attrs The attributes array.
00329      */
00330     public function applyAttrs(array $attrs) {
00331         if (!empty($attrs)) {
00332             return $this->addAttrs($attrs);
00333         } else {
00334             return false;
00335         }
00336     }
00337     
00338     /**
00339      * @brief Sets the attribute.
00340      * 
00341      * @param string $attr The attributes name.
00342      * @param string $value The attributes value.
00343      * 
00344      * @return bool Returns TRUE if successful, FALSE otherwise.
00345      * 
00346      * @code
00347      * $html->setAttr('id', 'myid');
00348      * @endcode
00349      */
00350     public function setAttr($attr, $value) {
00351         $attr = strtolower(trim($attr));
00352         $value = trim($value);
00353         
00354         if (Boo_Validator::isNull($value)) {
00355             if (BOO_DEBUG) { trigger_error('Value was null, are you sure this is what you wanted', E_USER_NOTICE); }
00356         }
00357         
00358         if ($attr == 'class') {
00359             // special clase for class attribute
00360             return $this->setClass($value);
00361         } else {
00362             $this->attributes[$attr] = htmlentities($value);
00363             return true;
00364         }
00365     }
00366     
00367     /**
00368      * @brief Returns the attributes value.
00369      * @param string $attr The attributes name.
00370      * @return string The attributes value if attribute is set, FALSE otherwise. 
00371      */
00372     public function getAttr($attr) {
00373         if (array_key_exists($attr, $this->attributes)) {
00374             return $this->attributes[$attr];
00375         } elseif ($attr == 'class') {
00376             return implode(' ', $this->classes);
00377         } else {
00378             return false;
00379         }
00380     }
00381     
00382     /**
00383      * @brief Determins if element has an attribute.
00384      * @param string $attr The attributes name.
00385      * @return bool Returns TRUE if the attribute is set (even to null), FALSE otherwise.
00386      */
00387     public function hasAttr($attr) {
00388         if (array_key_exists($attr, $this->attributes)) {
00389             return true;
00390         } elseif ($attr == 'class') {
00391             return !empty($this->classes);
00392             
00393         } else {
00394             return false;
00395         }
00396     }
00397     
00398     /**
00399      * @brief Removes attribute.
00400      * @param string $attr The attributes name.
00401      * @return bool Returns TRUE if successfull, FALSE otherwise. 
00402      */
00403     public function removeAttr($attr) {
00404         $attr = strtolower(trim($attr));
00405         
00406         if (array_key_exists($attr, $this->attributes)) {
00407             unset($this->attributes[$attr]);
00408             return true;
00409         } elseif ($attr == 'class') {
00410             $this->classes = array();
00411             return true;
00412         } else {
00413             return false;
00414         }
00415         
00416     }
00417     
00418     /**
00419      * @brief Removes array of attributes.
00420      * @return int Returns the number of attributes removed, FALSE on failure.
00421      * @param array $attrs The attributes to remove.
00422      */
00423     public function removeAttrs(array $attrs) {
00424         $count = 0;
00425         if (!empty($attrs)) {
00426             foreach ($attrs as $key => $value) {
00427                 if ($this->removeAttr($key)) {
00428                     $count++;
00429                 }
00430             }
00431         } else {
00432             if (BOO_DEBUG) { trigger_error('Attributes should not be empty', E_USER_NOTICE); }
00433             return false;
00434         }
00435         return $count;
00436     }
00437     
00438     /**
00439      * @brief Clears all attributes.
00440      * 
00441      * @since 2.0.0
00442      * @return bool Function always returns TRUE.
00443      */
00444     public function clearAttrs() { 
00445         $this->attributes = array();
00446         return true;
00447     }
00448     
00449     /**
00450      * @brief Sets the elements class.
00451      * 
00452      * Input may be a single name, space delimited string of names, or an array of names.
00453      * 
00454      * @param mixed $class The class(es) to set.
00455      * @return bool Returns TRUE if class was set, FALSE otherwise.
00456      * 
00457      * @code
00458      * $html->setClass('author name');
00459      * @endcode
00460      */
00461     public function setClass($class) {
00462         if (empty($class)) {
00463             // class is empty, nothing more to do
00464             return false;
00465         }
00466         
00467         // convert string to array
00468         if (is_string($class)) {
00469             // replace spaces with commas
00470             $str = str_replace(' ', ',', $class);
00471             $class = explode(',', $str);
00472         } elseif (is_array($class)) {
00473             break;
00474         } else {
00475             trigger_error('Class is not a string or array', E_USER_WARNING);
00476             return false;
00477         }
00478         
00479         // cleanup
00480         array_trim($class);
00481         $this->classes = $class;
00482         
00483         return true;
00484     }
00485     
00486     /**
00487      * @brief Determins if element has a given class.
00488      * 
00489      * @param mixed $class The class name to compare.
00490      * @return bool Returns TRUE if element has class, FALSE otherwise.
00491      */
00492     public function hasClass($class) {
00493         $class = trim($class);
00494         if (in_array($class, $this->classes)) {
00495             // found
00496             return true;
00497         } else {
00498             return false;
00499         }
00500     }
00501     
00502     /**
00503      * @brief Adds class(es) to element.
00504      * @param string $class The class(es) to add.
00505      * @return mixded If class(es) are added then the number of additions is returned, FALSE otherwise.
00506      */
00507     public function addClass($class) {
00508         if (is_string($class)) {
00509             $str = str_replace(' ', ',', $class);
00510             $class = explode(',', $str);
00511             
00512             if (count($class) == 1) {
00513                 // single class
00514                 $class = trim($class[0]);
00515                 if (in_array($class, $this->classes)) {
00516                     // already in array
00517                     return false;
00518                 } else {
00519                     // add to array
00520                     $this->classes[] = $class;
00521                     return 1;
00522                 }
00523             } else {
00524                 // more than one class
00525                 return $this->addClasses($class);
00526             }
00527         } elseif (is_array($class)) {
00528             return $this->addClasses($class);
00529         } else {
00530             trigger_error('Class must be a string or array', E_USER_WARNING);
00531             return false;
00532         }
00533     }
00534     
00535     /**
00536      * @brief Add classes to element.
00537      * @return int Returns the number of classes added, FALSE on failure.
00538      * @param array $classes The classes to add.
00539      */
00540     public function addClasses(array $classes) {
00541         $count = 0;
00542         if (!empty($classes)) {
00543             foreach ($classes as $class) {
00544                 if($this->addClass($class)){
00545                     $count++;
00546                 }
00547             }
00548         } else {
00549             if (BOO_DEBUG) { trigger_error('Classes should not be empty', E_USER_NOTICE); }
00550             return false;
00551         }
00552         
00553         return $count;
00554     }
00555     
00556     /**
00557      * @brief Removes class(es) from element.
00558      * @param mixed $class The class(es) to remove.
00559      * @return mixed If class(es) are found then the number removed is returned, FALSE otherwise.
00560      */
00561     public function removeClass($class) {
00562         if (is_string($class)) {
00563             $str = str_replace(' ', ',', $class);
00564             $class = explode(',', $str);
00565             
00566             if (count($class) == 1) {
00567                 // single class
00568                 $class = trim($class[0]);
00569                 $key = array_search($class, $this->classes);
00570                 if ($key !== false) {
00571                     // found in array
00572                     unset($this->classes[$key]);
00573                     return 1;
00574                 } else {
00575                     // not found
00576                     return false;
00577                 }
00578             } else {
00579                 // more than one class
00580                 return $this->addClasses($class);
00581             }
00582         } elseif (is_array($class)) {
00583             return $this->removeClasses($class);
00584         } else {
00585             trigger_error('Class must be a string or array', E_USER_WARNING);
00586             return false;
00587         }
00588     }
00589     
00590     /**
00591      * @brief Removes classes from element.
00592      * @return int Returns the number of classes removed, FALSE on failure.
00593      * @param array $classes The classes to be removed.
00594      */
00595     public function removeClasses(array $classes) {
00596         $count = 0;
00597         if (!empty($classes)) {
00598             foreach ($classes as $class) {
00599                 if ($this->removeClass($class)) {
00600                     $count++;
00601                 }
00602             }
00603         } else {
00604             if (BOO_DEBUG) { trigger_error('Classes should not be empty', E_USER_NOTICE); }
00605             return false;
00606         }
00607         return $count;
00608     }
00609     
00610         
00611     /**
00612      * @brief Toggles class(es) for element.
00613      * @param string $class The class(es) name.
00614      * @return int Returns the number of classes toggled, FALSE otherwise.
00615      */
00616     public function toggleClass($class) {
00617         
00618         if (is_string($class)) {
00619             $str = str_replace(' ', ',', $class);
00620             $class = explode(',', $str);
00621             
00622             if (count($class) == 1) {
00623                 // single class
00624                 $class = trim($class[0]);
00625                 if ($this->hasClass($class)) {
00626                     return (int) $this->removeClass($class);
00627                 } else {
00628                     return (int) $this->addClass($class);
00629                 }
00630             } else {
00631                 // more than one class
00632                 return $this->toggleClasses($class);
00633             }
00634         } elseif (is_array($class)) {
00635             return $this->toggleClasses($class);
00636         } else {
00637             trigger_error('Class must be a string or array', E_USER_WARNING);
00638             return false;
00639         }
00640     }
00641     
00642     /**
00643      * @brief Toggles classes for element.
00644      * @return int Returns number of classes toggled, FALSE on failure
00645      * @param array $classes Array of classes to toggle.
00646      */
00647     public function toggleClasse(array $classes) {
00648         $count = 0;
00649         if (!empty($classes)) {
00650             foreach ($classes as $class) {
00651                 if ($this->toggleClass($class)) {
00652                     $count++;
00653                 }
00654             }
00655         } else {
00656             if (BOO_DEBUG) { trigger_error('Classes should not be empty', E_USER_NOTICE); }
00657             return false;
00658         }   
00659         return $count;
00660     }
00661     
00662     /**
00663      * @brief Clears all classes.
00664      * 
00665      * @since 2.0.0
00666      * @return bool Function always returns TRUE.
00667      */
00668     public function clearClasses() { 
00669         $this->classes = array();
00670         return true;
00671     }
00672     
00673     /**
00674      * @brief Clears everything but the element.
00675      * 
00676      * @since 2.0.0
00677      * @return bool FUnction always returns TRUE.
00678      */
00679     public function clearAll() {
00680         $this->clearAttrs();
00681         $this->clearClasses();
00682         $this->clearContent();
00683         return true;
00684     }
00685     
00686     /**
00687      * @brief Sets the elements content.
00688      * @param string $content The content.
00689      * @param bool $cleanup[optional] Cleanup content.
00690      * @return bool Function always returns TRUE.
00691      * 
00692      * @code
00693      * $html->setContent("This is my first div.");
00694      * @endcode
00695      */
00696     public function setContent($content, $cleanup = true) {
00697         if ($cleanup) {
00698             $contnet = trim($content);
00699         }
00700         $this->clearContent();
00701         $this->content[] = $content;
00702         return true;
00703     }
00704     
00705     /**
00706      * @brief Appends content to the elements existing content.
00707      * @param string $content The content.
00708      * @param bool $cleanup[optional] Cleanup content.
00709      * @return bool Function always returns TRUE.
00710      */
00711     public function appendContent($content, $cleanup = true) {
00712         if ($cleanup) {
00713             $contnet = trim($content);
00714         }
00715         $this->content[] = $content;
00716         return true;
00717     }
00718     
00719     /**
00720      * @brief Prepend content to the elements existing content.
00721      * @param string $content The content.
00722      * @param bool $cleanup[optional] Cleanup content.
00723      * @return bool Function always returns TRUE.
00724      */
00725     public function prependContent($content, $cleanup = true) {
00726         if ($cleanup) {
00727             $contnet = trim($content);
00728         }
00729         array_unshift($this->content, $content);
00730         return true;
00731     }
00732     
00733     /** 
00734      * @brief Returns content.
00735      * @return array Content of the element.
00736      */
00737     public function getContent() {
00738         return $this->content;
00739     }
00740     
00741     /**
00742      * @brief Clears content.
00743      * @return bool Function always returns TRUE.
00744      */
00745     public function clearContent() {
00746         $this->content = array();
00747         return true;
00748     }
00749     
00750     /** 
00751      * @brief Returns inner HTML.
00752      * @return string The inner HTML from the element.
00753      */
00754     public function htmlInner() {
00755         $tmp = '';
00756         foreach ($this->content as $key => $value) {
00757             if ($value instanceof Boo_Html || ($value instanceof Html && BOO_CLASS)) {
00758                 $tmp .= $value->html();
00759             } else {
00760                 $tmp .= (string) $value; // type cast just to be sure
00761             }
00762         }
00763         return $tmp;
00764     }
00765     /** 
00766      * @brief Returns HTML.
00767      * @return string HTML for the element.
00768      * @param array $attrs[optional] Array of attributes.
00769      * 
00770      * @code
00771      * <div id="myid" class="auther name">This is my first div.</div>
00772      * @endcode
00773      */
00774     public function html(array $attrs = array()) {
00775         $this->applyAttrs($attrs);
00776         return $this->htmlOpen() . $this->htmlInner() . $this->htmlClose();
00777     }
00778     
00779     /** 
00780      * @brief Returns opening HTML tag.
00781      * @return string Opening HTML tag for the element.
00782      * 
00783      * @code
00784      * <div id="myid" class="auther name">
00785      * @endcode
00786      */
00787     public function htmlOpen() {
00788         $tmp = '';
00789         if ($this->isTagless()) {
00790             return $tmp;
00791         }
00792         
00793         $tmp .= "<{$this->element}";
00794         
00795         if (!empty($this->classes)) {
00796             $tmp .= ' class="' . implode(' ', $this->classes) . '"';
00797         }
00798         
00799         foreach($this->attributes as $key => $value) {
00800             $tmp .= " {$key}=\"{$value}\"";
00801         }
00802         
00803         $tmp .= '>';
00804         return $tmp;
00805     }
00806     
00807     /** 
00808      * @brief Returns closing HTML tag.
00809      * @return string Closing HTML tag for the element.
00810      * 
00811      * @code
00812      * </div>
00813      * @endcode
00814      */
00815     public function htmlClose() {
00816         $tmp = '';
00817         if ($this->isTagless()) {
00818             return $tmp;
00819         }
00820         
00821         $tmp .= "</{$this->element}>";
00822         return $tmp;
00823     }
00824     
00825     /**
00826      * @brief Determins if element has a tag.
00827      * @return bool Returns TRUE if element has a tag, FALSE otherwise (contains other tags, or is just test).
00828      */
00829     public function isTagless() {
00830         return !$this->element;
00831     }
00832     
00833     /**
00834      * @brief Determins if the object is valid.
00835      * 
00836      * This feature is not yet implemented! Added for future API compatibility.
00837      * 
00838      * @return bool Returns TRUE if object is valid, FALSE otherwise.
00839      * 
00840      * @todo Finish function and decide what is required for validity.
00841      */
00842     public function isValid() {
00843         return true;
00844     }
00845     
00846     /**
00847      * @brief Determins if content is empty.
00848      * 
00849      * @since 2.0.0
00850      * @return bool Returns TRUE if content is empty, FALSE otherwise.
00851      */
00852     public function isEmpty() { return empty($this->content); }
00853     
00854     
00855     /**
00856      * @brief Converts object to string.
00857      * @see Boo_Page::html()
00858      * @since 2.0.0
00859      * @return string Returns HTML for object.
00860      */
00861     public function __toString() { return $this->html(); }
00862 }
